item.title: Speed vs Depth: The Art of Investigation Theory in the Real World
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Learn to balance speed and thoroughness in MDR investigations using Kill Chain analysis and Likelihood vs Impact matrices to make fast, defensible decisions under pressure.

item.title: Learning in the AI Era - Part 3: Practical Workflow with NotebookLM
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: A hands-on guide to using NotebookLM for cybersecurity learning, including how to create study guides, generate flashcards, and build audio podcasts from technical documentation for active learning.

item.title: Learning in the AI Era - Part 2: The Learning Cycle
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Discover evidence-based learning frameworks including the three-phase Learning Cycle (Understanding, Remembering, Focusing) and how to adapt cybersecurity training to your personal learning style with AI.

item.title: Learning in the AI Era - Part 1: The Curiosity Crisis
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: AI isn’t making us stupider, our curiosity has been atrophying for years and AI just makes it visible. Learn why curiosity is a muscle you can rebuild and how to use AI as an amplifier, not a crutch.

item.title: MSSQL Cheat Sheet
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Microsoft SQL Server forensics and threat hunting guide covering registry paths, log locations, attack indicators, and configuration analysis for compromised SQL Server instances.

item.title: PXA Stealers Evolution to PureRAT: Part 6 - Finally, the Final Stage PureRAT (Stage 9)
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: After nine stages of obfuscation, the final payload reveals itself as PureRAT, a commercial .NET RAT using TLS-pinned C2, Protocol Buffers, and modular plugins for remote access and control.

item.title: PXA Stealers Evolution to PureRAT: Part 5 - Another Shift in Tactics (Stage 8)
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Advanced .NET loader dynamically loads assemblies from memory, decrypts payloads on-the-fly, and invokes methods without touching disk, requiring a pivot from static to dynamic analysis techniques.

item.title: PXA Stealers Evolution to PureRAT: Part 4 - .NET Payload Analysis (Stage 6 & 7)
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: The campaign shifts from Python to compiled .NET executables using process hollowing for in-memory PE injection, AMSI patching, and ETW unhooking to evade detection and establish persistence.

item.title: PXA Stealers Evolution to PureRAT: Part 3 - Weaponised Python Stage (Stage 5)
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Dissect PXA Stealer’s weaponized info-stealing payload that extracts Chrome credentials, cookies, and 2FA tokens using WMI for AV enumeration before exfiltrating everything via Telegram’s Bot API.

item.title: PXA Stealers Evolution to PureRAT: Part 2 - In-Memory Python Loading (Stages 3 & 4)
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Learn to disassemble Python bytecode and reconstruct custom hybrid encryption loaders as PXA Stealer uses multi-layered in-memory execution, registry persistence, and Telegram C2 to evade detection.

item.title: PXA Stealers Evolution to PureRAT: Part 1 - Basics of Python Reversing & Static Analysis (Stage 1 & 2)
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Uncover how a copyright phishing email delivers multi-stage Python malware through DLL sideloading, hidden archives, and Base64 obfuscation in this deep-dive intro to Python malware reverse engineering.

item.title: Sigma Rule Cheat Sheet
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Concise guide for writing Sigma detection rules covering structure, modifiers, best practices, and tools for SOC analysts and detection engineers working with Splunk, Elastic, or LogPoint.

item.title: A Familiar Crypto Scam Returns — With a More Convincing Face
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: A polished YouTube video promoting a fake TradingView AI feature nearly fooled security analysts with professional branding and clever social engineering, delivering NetSupport RAT through PowerShell to target crypto wallets.

item.title: Using NetTriage for IP & Domain Triage
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Automate IP and domain investigations with NetTriage, a Python tool that performs reputation lookups, DNS resolution, WHOIS checks, and passive DNS analysis for rapid threat triage.

item.title: Getting Started in Cyber Security
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: A comprehensive Australian guide to breaking into cybersecurity, covering red vs blue team paths, practical skills development, certifications, programming projects, and government career opportunities.

item.title: MacOS CLI Commands Cheat Sheet
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Essential macOS Terminal commands for file operations, process management, networking, Homebrew, and security controls like Gatekeeper and SIP for sysadmins and DFIR practitioners.

item.title: Markdown Cheatsheet
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Quick reference for Markdown syntax covering headings, formatting, lists, links, code blocks, and tables for documentation and technical writing.

item.title: Windows CLI Commands Cheat Sheet
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Fast-access PowerShell reference for system administration, automation, security auditing, covering file management, networking, scripting, and Winget for IT pros and analysts.

item.title: Windows Registry Cheat Sheet
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Key Windows Registry locations for persistence mechanisms, user activity traces, and IOC hunting in malware analysis and forensic investigations for DFIR professionals.

item.title: Malware Analysis Cheat Sheet
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Comprehensive reference for static and dynamic malware analysis using Ghidra, x64dbg, REMnux, including PDF analysis, unpacking techniques, and reverse engineering workflows. - static-analysis - dynamic-analysis

item.title: Windows Log Analysis Cheat Sheet (+ Chainsaw)
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Critical Windows event IDs, logon types, and log locations for threat hunting and incident response, including Security.evtx, PowerShell logs, and Chainsaw analysis techniques.

item.title: My Rack Setup - 2020 Extrusion DIY mini-rack
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Build your own compact 10-inch server rack using 2020 aluminium extrusion with detailed parts list, cut measurements, and assembly instructions for a modular homelab setup.

item.title: Regex Cheat Sheet
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Essential regex patterns for matching, capturing, and string manipulation adapted for security analysts, blue teamers, and SOC professionals working with detection rules.

item.title: IP & Domain Investigation Cheat Sheet
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Essential techniques for IP and domain investigations including reputation checks, WHOIS lookups, DNS inspection, passive intelligence, and payload retrieval for threat hunting and incident response.

item.title: Huntress - Weaponized Velociraptor Delivers Ransomware
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Investigation uncovered three distinct incidents where threat actors weaponized Velociraptor, a legitimate DFIR tool, for persistent command-and-control access. Attackers exploited SharePoint and WSUS vulnerabilities, installed Velociraptor as a Windows service communicating through Cloudflare tunnels, and deployed secondary tools including VS Code, OpenSSH, and TightVNC. One incident linked to Storm-2603 resulted in Warlock ransomware deployment.

item.title: BleepingComputer - PXA Stealer to PureRAT Deployment
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Vietnamese threat actor behind PXA Stealer has evolved their capabilities, deploying a sophisticated 10-stage attack chain culminating in PureRAT—a commercial .NET remote access trojan. The campaign demonstrates tactical maturity with DLL sideloading, multi-layer obfuscation, in-memory execution, and progression from credential theft to full system surveillance including hidden desktop access, webcam/microphone spying, and real-time keylogging.

item.title: The Hacker News - Chinese threat actors weaponizing new tools
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: Chinese-linked threat actors compromised over 100 systems across Taiwan, Japan, South Korea, and Hong Kong by weaponizing Nezha, an open-source monitoring tool, to deliver Gh0st RAT. The sophisticated attack chain exploited vulnerable phpMyAdmin panels using log poisoning techniques, deployed web shells via SQL injection, and used the Nezha agent for remote command execution before delivering the final payload.

item.title: Projects
item.author: james.northey@proton.me (Darkrym)
item.description: This space highlights a handful of personal and professional projects, from deep dives into malware internals to physical-layer tinkering, and the occasional development of tools/systems to simplify my life in a SOC. It’s a mix of discipline, obsession, and curiosity.
